00067 /** Given an LLVM type, try to find the equivalent ispc type.  Note that
00068     this is an under-constrained problem due to LLVM's type representations
00069     carrying less information than ispc's.  (For example, LLVM doesn't
00070     distinguish between signed and unsigned integers in its types.)
00071 
00072     Because this function is only used for generating ispc declarations of
00073     functions defined in LLVM bitcode in the builtins-*.ll files, in practice
00074     we can get enough of what we need for the relevant cases to make things
00075     work, partially with the help of the intAsUnsigned parameter, which
00076     indicates whether LLVM integer types should be treated as being signed
00077     or unsigned.
00078 
00079  */
00080 static const Type *
00081 lLLVMTypeToISPCType(const llvm::Type *t, bool intAsUnsigned) {
00082     if (t == LLVMTypes::VoidType)
00083         return AtomicType::Void;
00084 
00085     // uniform
00086     else if (t == LLVMTypes::BoolType)
00087         return AtomicType::UniformBool;
00088     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int8Type)
00089         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt8 : AtomicType::UniformInt8;
00090     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int16Type)
00091         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt16 : AtomicType::UniformInt16;
00092     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32Type)
00093         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt32;
00094     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatType)
00095         return AtomicType::UniformFloat;
00096     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoubleType)
00097         return AtomicType::UniformDouble;
00098     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
00099         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt64 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
00100 
00101     // varying
00102     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType)
00103         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt8 : AtomicType::VaryingInt8;
00104     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType)
00105         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt16 : AtomicType::VaryingInt16;
00106     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
00107         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 : AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00108     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType)
00109         return AtomicType::VaryingFloat;
00110     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType)
00111         return AtomicType::VaryingDouble;
00112     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType)
00113         return intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt64 : AtomicType::VaryingInt64;
00114 
00115     // pointers to uniform
00116     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int8PointerType)
00117         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt8 :
00118                                                  AtomicType::UniformInt8, false);
00119     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int16PointerType)
00120         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt16 :
00121                                                  AtomicType::UniformInt16, false);
00122     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32PointerType)
00123         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
00124                                                  AtomicType::UniformInt32, false);
00125     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64PointerType)
00126         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::UniformUInt64 :
00127                                                  AtomicType::UniformInt64, false);
00128     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatPointerType)
00129         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::UniformFloat, false);
00130     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoublePointerType)
00131         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::UniformDouble, false);
00132 
00133     // pointers to varying
00134     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int8VectorPointerType)
00135         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt8 :
00136                                                  AtomicType::VaryingInt8, false);
00137     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int16VectorPointerType)
00138         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt16 :
00139                                                  AtomicType::VaryingInt16, false);
00140     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorPointerType)
00141         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 :
00142                                                  AtomicType::VaryingInt32, false);
00143     else if (t == LLVMTypes::Int64VectorPointerType)
00144         return new ReferenceType(intAsUnsigned ? AtomicType::VaryingUInt64 :
00145                                                  AtomicType::VaryingInt64, false);
00146     else if (t == LLVMTypes::FloatVectorPointerType)
00147         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::VaryingFloat, false);
00148     else if (t == LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorPointerType)
00149         return new ReferenceType(AtomicType::VaryingDouble, false);
00150 
00151     // arrays
00152     else if (llvm::isa<const llvm::PointerType>(t)) {
00153         const llvm::PointerType *pt = llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::PointerType>(t);
00154 
00155         // Is it a pointer to an unsized array of objects?  If so, then
00156         // create the equivalent ispc type.  Note that it has to be a
00157         // reference to an array, since ispc passes arrays to functions by
00158         // reference.
00159         const llvm::ArrayType *at = 
00160             llvm::dyn_cast<const llvm::ArrayType>(pt->getElementType());
00161         if (at != NULL) {
00162             const Type *eltType = lLLVMTypeToISPCType(at->getElementType(),
00163                                                       intAsUnsigned);
00164             if (eltType == NULL)
00165                 return NULL;
00166             return new ReferenceType(new ArrayType(eltType, at->getNumElements()),
00167                                      false);
00168         }
00169     }
00170 
00171     return NULL;
00172 }

00174 
00175 static void
00176 lCreateSymbol(const std::string &name, const Type *returnType, 
00177               const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes, 
00178               const llvm::FunctionType *ftype, llvm::Function *func, 
00179               SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00180     SourcePos noPos;
00181     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00182 
00183     FunctionType *funcType = new FunctionType(returnType, argTypes, noPos);
00184     // set NULL default arguments
00185     std::vector<ConstExpr *> defaults;
00186     for (unsigned int j = 0; j < ftype->getNumParams(); ++j)
00187         defaults.push_back(NULL);
00188     funcType->SetArgumentDefaults(defaults);
00189 
00190     Symbol *sym = new Symbol(name, noPos, funcType);
00191     sym->function = func;
00192     symbolTable->AddFunction(sym);
00193 }

00195 
00196 /** Given an LLVM function declaration, synthesize the equivalent ispc
00197     symbol for the function (if possible).  Returns true on success, false
00198     on failure.
00199  */
00200 static bool
00201 lCreateISPCSymbol(llvm::Function *func, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00202     SourcePos noPos;
00203     noPos.name = "__stdlib";
00204 
00205     const llvm::FunctionType *ftype = func->getFunctionType();
00206     std::string name = func->getName();
00207 
00208     if (name.size() < 3 || name[0] != '_' || name[1] != '_')
00209         return false;
00210 
00211     // An unfortunate hack: we want this builtin function to have the
00212     // signature "int __sext_varying_bool(bool)", but the ispc function
00213     // symbol creation code below assumes that any LLVM vector of i32s is a
00214     // varying int32.  Here, we need that to be interpreted as a varying
00215     // bool, so just have a one-off override for that one...
00216     if (name == "__sext_varying_bool") {
00217         const Type *returnType = AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00218         std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
00219         argTypes.push_back(AtomicType::VaryingBool);
00220         std::vector<ConstExpr *> defaults;
00221         defaults.push_back(NULL);
00222 
00223         FunctionType *funcType = new FunctionType(returnType, argTypes, noPos);
00224         funcType->SetArgumentDefaults(defaults);
00225 
00226         Symbol *sym = new Symbol(name, noPos, funcType);
00227         sym->function = func;
00228         symbolTable->AddFunction(sym);
00229         return true;
00230     }
00231 
00232     // If the function has any parameters with integer types, we'll make
00233     // two Symbols for two overloaded versions of the function, one with
00234     // all of the integer types treated as signed integers and one with all
00235     // of them treated as unsigned.
00236     for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
00237         bool intAsUnsigned = (i == 1);
00238 
00239         const Type *returnType = lLLVMTypeToISPCType(ftype->getReturnType(),
00240                                                      intAsUnsigned);
00241         if (!returnType)
00242             // return type not representable in ispc -> not callable from ispc
00243             return false;
00244 
00245         // Iterate over the arguments and try to find their equivalent ispc
00246         // types.  Track if any of the arguments has an integer type.
00247         bool anyIntArgs = false, anyReferenceArgs = false;
00248         std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
00249         for (unsigned int j = 0; j < ftype->getNumParams(); ++j) {
00250             const llvm::Type *llvmArgType = ftype->getParamType(j);
00251             const Type *type = lLLVMTypeToISPCType(llvmArgType, intAsUnsigned);
00252             if (type == NULL)
00253                 return false;
00254             anyIntArgs |= 
00255                 (Type::Equal(type, lLLVMTypeToISPCType(llvmArgType, !intAsUnsigned)) == false);
00256             anyReferenceArgs |= (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL);
00257             argTypes.push_back(type);
00258         }
00259 
00260         // Always create the symbol the first time through, in particular
00261         // so that we get symbols for things with no integer types!
00262         if (i == 0 || anyIntArgs == true)
00263             lCreateSymbol(name, returnType, argTypes, ftype, func, symbolTable);
00264 
00265         // If there are any reference types, also make a variant of the
00266         // symbol that has them as const references.  This obviously
00267         // doesn't make sense for many builtins, but we'll give the stdlib
00268         // the option to call one if it needs one.
00269         if (anyReferenceArgs == true) {
00270             for (unsigned int j = 0; j < argTypes.size(); ++j) {
00271                 if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(argTypes[j]) != NULL)
00272                     argTypes[j] = argTypes[j]->GetAsConstType();
00273                 lCreateSymbol(name + "_refsconst", returnType, argTypes, 
00274                               ftype, func, symbolTable);
00275             }
00276         }
00277     }
00278 
00279     return true;
00280 }

00283 /** Given an LLVM module, create ispc symbols for the functions in the
00284     module.
00285  */
00286 static void
00287 lAddModuleSymbols(llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00288 #if 0
00289     // FIXME: handle globals?
00290     assert(module->global_empty());
00291 #endif
00292 
00293     llvm::Module::iterator iter;
00294     for (iter = module->begin(); iter != module->end(); ++iter) {
00295         llvm::Function *func = iter;
00296         lCreateISPCSymbol(func, symbolTable);
00297     }
00298 }
00299 
00300 
00301 /** In many of the builtins-*.ll files, we have declarations of various LLVM
00302     intrinsics that are then used in the implementation of various target-
00303     specific functions.  This function loops over all of the intrinsic 
00304     declarations and makes sure that the signature we have in our .ll file
00305     matches the signature of the actual intrinsic.
00306 */
00307 static void
00308 lCheckModuleIntrinsics(llvm::Module *module) {
00309     llvm::Module::iterator iter;
00310     for (iter = module->begin(); iter != module->end(); ++iter) {
00311         llvm::Function *func = iter;
00312         if (!func->isIntrinsic())
00313             continue;
00314 
00315         const std::string funcName = func->getName().str();
00316         // Work around http://llvm.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=10438; only
00317         // check the llvm.x86.* intrinsics for now...
00318         if (!strncmp(funcName.c_str(), "llvm.x86.", 9)) {
00319             llvm::Intrinsic::ID id = (llvm::Intrinsic::ID)func->getIntrinsicID();
00320             assert(id != 0);
00321             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *intrinsicType = 
00322                 llvm::Intrinsic::getType(*g->ctx, id);
00323             intrinsicType = llvm::PointerType::get(intrinsicType, 0);
00324             assert(func->getType() == intrinsicType);
00325         }
00326     }
00327 }

00330 /** This utility function takes serialized binary LLVM bitcode and adds its
00331     definitions to the given module.  Functions in the bitcode that can be
00332     mapped to ispc functions are also added to the symbol table.
00333 
00334     @param bitcode     Binary LLVM bitcode (e.g. the contents of a *.bc file)
00335     @param length      Length of the bitcode buffer
00336     @param module      Module to link the bitcode into
00337     @param symbolTable Symbol table to add definitions to
00338  */
00339 static void
00340 lAddBitcode(const unsigned char *bitcode, int length,
00341             llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00342     std::string bcErr;
00343     llvm::StringRef sb = llvm::StringRef((char *)bitcode, length);
00344     llvm::MemoryBuffer *bcBuf = llvm::MemoryBuffer::getMemBuffer(sb);
00345     llvm::Module *bcModule = llvm::ParseBitcodeFile(bcBuf, *g->ctx, &bcErr);
00346     if (!bcModule)
00347         Error(SourcePos(), "Error parsing stdlib bitcode: %s", bcErr.c_str());
00348     else {
00349         // FIXME: this feels like a bad idea, but the issue is that when we
00350         // set the llvm::Module's target triple in the ispc Module::Module
00351         // constructor, we start by calling llvm::sys::getHostTriple() (and
00352         // then change the arch if needed).  Somehow that ends up giving us
00353         // strings like 'x86_64-apple-darwin11.0.0', while the stuff we
00354         // compile to bitcode with clang has module triples like
00355         // 'i386-apple-macosx10.7.0'.  And then LLVM issues a warning about
00356         // linking together modules with incompatible target triples..
00357         llvm::Triple mTriple(m->module->getTargetTriple());
00358         llvm::Triple bcTriple(bcModule->getTargetTriple());
00359         assert(bcTriple.getArch() == llvm::Triple::UnknownArch ||
00360                mTriple.getArch() == bcTriple.getArch());
00361         assert(bcTriple.getVendor() == llvm::Triple::UnknownVendor ||
00362                mTriple.getVendor() == bcTriple.getVendor());
00363         bcModule->setTargetTriple(mTriple.str());
00364 
00365         std::string(linkError);
00366         if (llvm::Linker::LinkModules(module, bcModule, &linkError))
00367             Error(SourcePos(), "Error linking stdlib bitcode: %s", linkError.c_str());
00368         lAddModuleSymbols(module, symbolTable);
00369         lCheckModuleIntrinsics(module);
00370     }
00371 }

00374 /** Utility routine that defines a constant int32 with given value, adding
00375     the symbol to both the ispc symbol table and the given LLVM module.
00376  */
00377 static void
00378 lDefineConstantInt(const char *name, int val, llvm::Module *module,
00379                    SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00380     Symbol *pw = new Symbol(name, SourcePos(), AtomicType::UniformConstInt32);
00381     pw->isStatic = true;
00382     pw->constValue = new ConstExpr(pw->type, val, SourcePos());
00383     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ltype = LLVMTypes::Int32Type;
00384     llvm::Constant *linit = LLVMInt32(val);
00385     pw->storagePtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*module, ltype, true, 
00386                                               llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
00387                                               linit, pw->name.c_str());
00388     symbolTable->AddVariable(pw);
00389 }

00392 static void
00393 lDefineProgramIndex(llvm::Module *module, SymbolTable *symbolTable) {
00394     Symbol *pidx = new Symbol("programIndex", SourcePos(), 
00395                               AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32);
00396     pidx->isStatic = true;
00397 
00398     int pi[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00399     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
00400         pi[i] = i;
00401     pidx->constValue = new ConstExpr(pidx->type, pi, SourcePos());
00402 
00403     LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ltype = LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
00404     llvm::Constant *linit = LLVMInt32Vector(pi);
00405     pidx->storagePtr = new llvm::GlobalVariable(*module, ltype, true, 
00406                                                 llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage, linit, 
00407                                                 pidx->name.c_str());
00408     symbolTable->AddVariable(pidx);
00409 }

00411 
00412 void
00413 DefineStdlib(SymbolTable *symbolTable, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, llvm::Module *module,
00414              bool includeStdlibISPC) {
00415     // Add the definitions from the compiled builtins-c.c file
00416     if (g->target.is32bit) {
00417         extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_c_32[];
00418         extern int builtins_bitcode_c_32_length;
00419         lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_c_32, builtins_bitcode_c_32_length, 
00420                     module, symbolTable);
00421     }
00422     else {
00423         extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_c_64[];
00424         extern int builtins_bitcode_c_64_length;
00425         lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_c_64, builtins_bitcode_c_64_length, 
00426                     module, symbolTable);
00427     }
00428 
00429     // Next, add the target's custom implementations of the various needed
00430     // builtin functions (e.g. __masked_store_32(), etc).
00431     switch (g->target.isa) {
00432     case Target::SSE2:
00433         extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_sse2[];
00434         extern int builtins_bitcode_sse2_length;
00435         lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_sse2, builtins_bitcode_sse2_length, module,
00436                     symbolTable);
00437         break;
00438     case Target::SSE4:
00439         extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_sse4[];
00440         extern int builtins_bitcode_sse4_length;
00441         extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_sse4x2[];
00442         extern int builtins_bitcode_sse4x2_length;
00443         switch (g->target.vectorWidth) {
00444         case 4: 
00445             lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_sse4, builtins_bitcode_sse4_length, 
00446                         module, symbolTable);
00447             break;
00448         case 8:
00449             lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_sse4x2, builtins_bitcode_sse4x2_length, 
00450                         module, symbolTable);
00451             break;
00452         default:
00453             FATAL("logic error in DefineStdlib");
00454         }
00455         break;
00456     case Target::AVX:
00457         switch (g->target.vectorWidth) {
00458         case 8:
00459             extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_avx[];
00460             extern int builtins_bitcode_avx_length;
00461             lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_avx, builtins_bitcode_avx_length, module, 
00462                         symbolTable);
00463             break;
00464         case 16:
00465             extern unsigned char builtins_bitcode_avx_x2[];
00466             extern int builtins_bitcode_avx_x2_length;
00467             lAddBitcode(builtins_bitcode_avx_x2, builtins_bitcode_avx_x2_length,
00468                         module,  symbolTable);
00469             break;
00470         default:
00471             FATAL("logic error in DefineStdlib");
00472         }
00473         break;
00474     default:
00475         FATAL("logic error");
00476     }
00477 
00478     // define the 'programCount' builtin variable
00479     lDefineConstantInt("programCount", g->target.vectorWidth, module, symbolTable);
00480 
00481     // define the 'programIndex' builtin
00482     lDefineProgramIndex(module, symbolTable);
00483 
00484     // Define __math_lib stuff.  This is used by stdlib.ispc, for example, to
00485     // figure out which math routines to end up calling...
00486     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib", (int)g->mathLib, module, symbolTable);
00487     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_ispc", (int)Globals::Math_ISPC, module,
00488                        symbolTable);
00489     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_ispc_fast", (int)Globals::Math_ISPCFast, 
00490                        module, symbolTable);
00491     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_svml", (int)Globals::Math_SVML, module,
00492                        symbolTable);
00493     lDefineConstantInt("__math_lib_system", (int)Globals::Math_System, module,
00494                        symbolTable);
00495 
00496     if (includeStdlibISPC) {
00497         // If the user wants the standard library to be included, parse the
00498         // serialized version of the stdlib.ispc file to get its
00499         // definitions added.  Disable emission of performance warnings for
00500         // now, since the user doesn't care about any of that in the stdlib
00501         // implementation...
00502         bool epf = g->emitPerfWarnings;
00503         g->emitPerfWarnings = false;
00504         extern char stdlib_code[];
00505         yy_scan_string(stdlib_code);
00506         yyparse();
00507         g->emitPerfWarnings = epf;
00508     }
00509 }
